00028 /* Includes ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00029 #include "ht32.h"
00030 #include "ht32_board.h"
00031 
00032 /** @addtogroup HT32_Series_Peripheral_Examples HT32 Peripheral Examples
00033   * @{
00034   */
00035 
00036 /** @addtogroup BFTM_Examples BFTM
00037   * @{
00038   */
00039 
00040 /** @addtogroup TimeMeasure
00041   * @{
00042   */
00043 
00044 
00045 /* Settings ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00046 #define HTCFG_MEASURE_IPN                         BFTM0
00047 #define HTCFG_MEASURE_PORT                        STRCAT2(HT_, HTCFG_MEASURE_IPN)
00048 
00049 #if (LIBCFG_BFTM_16BIT_COUNTER)
00050 #define BFTM_COMPARE_VALUE   (0xFFFF) // Maximum value of 16-bit counter
00051 #else
00052 #define BFTM_COMPARE_VALUE   (0xFFFFFFFF) // Maximum value of 32-bit counter
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 /* Private function prototypes -----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00056 void BFTM_Configuration(void);
00057 void TimeMeasureFun(void);
00058 
00059 static void TestFun1(void);
00060 void TestFun2(void);
00061 
00062 /* Private macro -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00063 #define MeasureStart()                            {HTCFG_MEASURE_PORT->SR = 0; HTCFG_MEASURE_PORT->CNTR = 0;}
00064 #define MeasureEnd(cnt)                           (cnt = HTCFG_MEASURE_PORT->CNTR)
00065 #define IsMeasureOverflow()                       (BFTM_GetFlagStatus(HTCFG_MEASURE_PORT))
00066 
00067 /* Global variables ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00068 s32 a;
00069 s32 b;
00070 s32 c;
00071 
00072 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00073 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00074   * @brief  Main program.
00075   * @retval None
00076   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00077 int main(void)
00078 {
00079   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED1);
00080   RETARGET_Configuration();
00081 
00082   BFTM_Configuration();
00083   TimeMeasureFun();
00084 
00085   while (1)
00086   {
00087   }
00088 }
00089 
00090 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00091   * @brief  BFTM Configuration.
00092   * @retval None
00093   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00094 void BFTM_Configuration(void)
00095 {
00096   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{ 0 }};
00097   CKCUClock.Bit.HTCFG_MEASURE_IPN      = 1;
00098   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00099 
00100   BFTM_SetCompare(HTCFG_MEASURE_PORT, BFTM_COMPARE_VALUE);  // Set to maximum value to detect the timer overflow
00101   BFTM_SetCounter(HTCFG_MEASURE_PORT, 0);
00102   BFTM_EnaCmd(HTCFG_MEASURE_PORT, ENABLE);
00103 }
00104 
00105 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00106   * @brief  Time measure function example.
00107   * @retval None
00108   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00109 void TimeMeasureFun(void)
00110 {
00111   u32 uCount;
00112 
00113   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00114   /* Measure the UART 1 bytes                                                                               */
00115   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00116   MeasureStart();
00117   {
00118     RETARGET_USART_PORT->DR = 'a';
00119     while ((RETARGET_USART_PORT->SR & USART_FLAG_TXC) == 0);
00120   }
00121   MeasureEnd(uCount); // Time count based on the system clock, t = uCount/SystemCoreClock
00122   #if 1
00123   if (IsMeasureOverflow()) // Shall check the timer overflow, close to the "MeasureEnd()"
00124   {
00125     printf("\r\nTimer overflow, the uCount is invalid!\r\n"); // Timer overflow, the uCount is invalid
00126   }
00127   #endif
00128   printf("\r\nMeasure 1 Count=%4u, T=%2.9f mS\r\n", uCount, ((float)uCount)/((float)SystemCoreClock/1000));
00129 
00130 
00131   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00132   /* Measure the LED API execution timing                                                                   */
00133   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00134   MeasureStart();
00135   {
00136     HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED1);
00137   }
00138   MeasureEnd(uCount); // Time count based on the system clock, t = uCount/SystemCoreClock
00139 
00140   printf("Measure 2 Count=%4u, T=%2.9f uS\r\n", uCount, ((float)uCount)/((float)SystemCoreClock/1000000));
00141 
00142 
00143   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00144   /* Measure the division execution timing                                                                  */
00145   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00146   a = 978520;
00147   b = 48;
00148   MeasureStart();
00149   {
00150     c = a/b;
00151   }
00152   MeasureEnd(uCount); // Time count based on the system clock, t = uCount/SystemCoreClock
00153 
00154   printf("Measure 3 Count=%4u, T=%2.9f S %d\r\n", uCount, ((float)uCount)/SystemCoreClock, c);
00155 
00156 
00157   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00158   /* Measure the instruction/function execution timing (may have the Flash Wait effect)                     */
00159   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00160   MeasureStart();
00161   {
00162     TestFun1();
00163   }
00164   MeasureEnd(uCount); // Time count based on the system clock, t = uCount/SystemCoreClock
00165 
00166   printf("Measure 4 Count=%4u, T=%2.9f S\r\n", uCount, ((float)uCount)/SystemCoreClock);
00167 
00168 
00169   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00170   /* Measure the instruction/function execution timing (may have the Flash Wait effect)                     */
00171   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00172   MeasureStart();
00173   {
00174     TestFun2();
00175   }
00176   MeasureEnd(uCount); // Time count based on the system clock, t = uCount/SystemCoreClock
00177 
00178   printf("Measure 5 Count=%4u, T=%2.9f S\r\n", uCount, ((float)uCount)/SystemCoreClock);
00179 
00180 }
00181 
00182 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00183   * @brief  Test function 1 (with "static", shall be inline).
00184   * @retval None
00185   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00186 static void TestFun1(void)
00187 {
00188   {__NOP();__NOP();__NOP();__NOP();__NOP();__NOP();}
00189 }
00190 
00191 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00192   * @brief  Test function 2 (without "static", may needs function jump overhead).
00193   * @retval None
00194   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00195 void TestFun2(void)
00196 {
00197   {__NOP();__NOP();__NOP();__NOP();__NOP();__NOP();}
00198 }
00199 
00200 #if (HT32_LIB_DEBUG == 1)
00201 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00202   * @brief  Report both the error name of the source file and the source line number.
00203   * @param  filename: pointer to the source file name.
00204   * @param  uline: error line source number.
00205   * @retval None
00206   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00207 void assert_error(u8* filename, u32 uline)
00208 {
00209   /*
00210      This function is called by IP library that the invalid parameters has been passed to the library API.
00211      Debug message can be added here.
00212      Example: printf("Parameter Error: file %s on line %d\r\n", filename, uline);
00213   */
00214 
00215   while (1)
00216   {
00217   }
00218 }
00219 #endif
